intro: Clompanus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy clompanus, is a unique plant species characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and distinctive floral structure. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and prefers well-drained soil. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in umbels, which is a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Clompanus pubescens is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
